host.description: The server host and port number to connect to. This can be the address of any node in the cluster.

port.description: The server port to connect to. Note: The port number can also be specified via --host.

user.description: The SQL user that will own the client session.

certs_dir.description: The path to the certificate directory containing the CA and client certificates and client key.

url.description: A connection URL to use instead of the other arguments.

format.description: How to display table rows printed to the standard output. Possible values: tsv, csv, table, records, sql, html.

timeout.description: Set the duration of time that the subcommand is allowed to run before it returns an error and prints partial information. The timeout is specified with a suffix of s for seconds, m for minutes, and h for hours. If this flag is not set, the subcommand may hang.
